title: @Meddler: So Garen is scheduled for a gameplay update
body:
please be gentle. i dont think he needs more than minor changes. we also dont know how the fighter item changes that are supposed to hit the pbe in a  couple weeks will affect him.

i see him generally as a pretty well balance champion. clear strengths, and clear weaknesses. hes overall not in a terrible spot right now. his lategame still feels like its lacking, but that might be fixed with fiddling with his scalings and some minor tweaks.

overall a couple pointers:

- critical strike as a stat interacts badly with his q. he doesnt have many options to itemize into it, so youre mostly dependent on RNGesus to grant you that crit on decisive strike. its a similar problem with the old gangplank where to crit or not to crit makes a large difference for the outcome of a fight and his overall effectiveness. this could be fixed by flattening out the crit scaling on his spells the same way with what you did with ashe, and making the stat more reliable.

- critical strikes only apply partially to his abilities, so it doesnt feel fully rewarding to itemize into it if you do. either an increase on the crit scaling would be a nice idea as it mostly affects his lategame. or cause critical strikes to deal the same damage, but apply the bonus damgage somehow as a separate damage instance. this means, more crits = faster cleaver stacks. so even just having a ghostblade has some reliable effect on his spin.

- the self slow on his spin that you put into place was supposed to be a mechanic for the early lane phase, to make it not quite as easy for garen to kite his opponent through minions or chase him down this way. however, it screws him over through the entire game. it happens too often, that you scratch a jungle monster, or minion in a teamfight down the lane, and completely lose your ability to stick to your intended target. it would be nice if there was a way to lose the self slow past the lane phase.

- someone brought up the idea to give him the ability to ult large and epic jungle monsters (tops 1k damage like similar abilities) to add some team utility to the champion without directly affecting his power in terms of being able to fight another champion. it would give a team more or a reason to want a garen with them in the game.

those are just some thoughts i gathered from playing and discussing the champion. imo a larger rework is not needed. for whatever that counts.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

in case anyone wondered what im talking about. hes officially next on the list.

That's pretty accurate as to our thinking on silences (can be a good fit on champs where there are things you can do to avoid the silence, generally not appropriate on characters who have the tools to silence you with really high reliability). Tryndamere is on the same spot (especially since he can activate his ult despite being silenced).

On top of that, silence does nothing to prevent a champion from coming to you, so if they are already on top of you, many times you would wish that you had a stun instead.

Silence is a good CC, but they are not really that powerful.

Depends on the champion, really. Auto attacking champs won't be hit too hard, as will tanks who would love to absorb a silence for their team.

Mages would be absolutely destroyed, since all they have is their abilities. A two second long silence on a {{champion:90}} {{champion:103}} etc. may as well be a two second stun since they generally don't itemize for movement speed like a melee champ. Assassins jumping in a teamfight and getting silenced probably means a death sentence since now they can't escape without running through your team.

Who doesn't want to see {{champion:92}} {{champion:7}} getting silenced more often?

It's also very difficult to land is it's both delayed and telegraphed.

Our approach with the primary tags on each character is generally to reflect what a champion is trying to do in a fight, rather than how they build. Garen's there primarily for damage for example. He does bring a little bit of CC, and he's happy to soak up some damage where he can, but his ideal goal is to spin on someone then ult them for a kill. Tanks by contrast, even if they've got similar builds, tend to be much more focused on setting up the enemy team for others to kill and/or protecting their own team. Lot of disruption basically, most often through CC.

The snowball element is a pretty significant part of his problem. He's great when he can afford to put gold into stat-inefficient items like Righteous Glory and he gets plenty of opportunities to initiate. He's not so good when he's behind and has to do his job while going straight for the fighting items that don't actually help him initiate, because his kit does not give him ample to reliably initiate past the laning phase without some amount of item assistance. This does tie in with the cost of his core items. He's extremely reliant on Sheen and some resistances-based tank stats, but that does cost a lot to build (particularly triforce). Unless he's ahead enough to give up on fighting potential, he has to buy triforce and a strong resistances item, putting off the utility items he so desperately needs.

I'd add to this that the ease with which he is countered is also a problem worth fixing. He just doesn't have any mechanisms to respond to some of the long-ranged or defensively oriented champions. I get that he's supposed to be weak to someone who can outrange him and/or lock him down while he's getting in, but his problems go beyond being weak. He can ust feel completely and utterly useless in those situations.

In this way he seems like a pub stomp champion where he is best used against a disorganized team to make the most out of his ultimate.

It shouldn't be something that lets him build full tank and be useful (I don't want to see him as a tank either), and hopefully the new items they're planning for AD Bruisers will help the whole 'AD Bruisers build full tank with maybe one offensive item' problem that's existed since forever.

It's not that rare currently. {{champion:59}} , {{champion:86}} , {{champion:23}} , {{champion:114}} , {{champion:92}} , {{champion:62}} , {{champion:107}} , and many {{champion:58}} s build almost completely damage these days. I know you said "unless you're a carry," but I think the reality is is that many (if not most) top laners are melee champs that build mostly damage. 

I think the problem is that as you mentioned the meta has been either "Build Tiamat/BC/Brutalizer and then 5 tank items" or the more current meta of, "Eff it, build all damage."
